meanings.sent1: The prisoner made a breakaway from the guards and ran into the forest.
meanings.sent2: The breakaway of the thief caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a breakaway from the bird feeder, leaving the birds confused.
meanings.sent4: Her heart made a breakaway from reality, soaring into the realm of dreams.
meanings.sent5: The breakaway of the balloon from the child's hand was a moment of pure freedom.

meanings.definition: A person or group that leaves a larger group to form a separate entity
meanings.sent1: The breakaway faction established their own rules and traditions.
meanings.sent2: The breakaway from the main group led to the formation of a new community.
meanings.sent3: The breakaway group decided to start their own club for stargazing.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was a breakaway from the mundane reality surrounding her.
meanings.sent5: The breakaway of the artist from traditional techniques resulted in groundbreaking artwork.

meanings.definition: A play in sports where a player breaks free from defenders and moves towards the goal
meanings.sent1: The striker's breakaway towards the goal left the defenders behind.
meanings.sent2: The breakaway by the forward led to a clear shot on target.
meanings.sent3: The breakaway play was so swift that the defenders couldn't keep up.
meanings.sent4: His breakaway on the field was like a lightning bolt through the defense.
meanings.sent5: The breakaway moment in the game was when the crowd erupted in cheers.
